conclusion: Determine the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched.
The Lorentz force acting on the projectile is given by F = I * d * B.
Values: I = 10 A, d = 0.02 m, B = 1 T.
Calculate Lorentz force: F = 10 A * 0.02 m * 1 T = 0.2 N.
Using Newton's second law, F = m * a, find acceleration a.
Calculate acceleration: a = 0.2 N / 0.02 kg = 10 m/s².
Velocity at the end of the rail using v² = u² + 2as.
Values: u = 0 m/s, a = 10 m/s², s = 0.5 m.
Calculate velocity: v² = 0 + 2 * 10 m/s² * 0.5 m = 10 m²/s², v = √10 m/s ≈ 3.16 m/s.
Power is given by P = F * v.
Calculate power: P = 0.2 N * 3.16 m/s ≈ 0.632 W.
The power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is approximately 0.632 watts.
